history.proof: intros x H. destruct H as [Hdiv1 [Hdiv2 Hgcd]]. shelve.

chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof, without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Sovle This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
p: nat
Hp: p <> 0

Goal:
forall x, is_gcd p (proj1_sig x) 1 -> {i : Z_Zp | i ⊗ x = Op}

Premises:
Inductive nat : Set := O : nat | S : nat -> nat Arguments S _%nat_scope
proj1_sig : forall (A : Type) (P : A -> Prop), {x : A | P x} -> A
Z_Zp = {x : nat | x < p} : Set
Notation Op := Zp_one
is_gcd = fun p q r : nat => divides r p /\ divides r q /\ (forall k : nat, divides k p -> divides k q -> divides k r) : nat -> nat -> nat -> Prop Arguments is_gcd (_ _ _)%nat_scope
Fin.to_nat = fix to_nat (m : nat) (n : Fin.t m) {struct n} : {i : nat | i < m} := match n in (Fin.t n0) return {i : nat | i < n0} with | @Fin.F1 j => exist (fun i : nat => i < S j) 0 (Nat.lt_0_succ j) | @Fin.FS n0 p => let (i, P) := to_nat n0 p in exist (fun i0 : nat => i0 < S n0) (S i) (lt_n_S i n0 P) end : forall m : nat, Fin.t m -> {i : nat | i < m} Arguments Fin.to_nat {m}%nat_scope
Zp_mult_one : forall x, Op ⊗ x = x
Zp_mult_one_r : forall x, x ⊗ Op = x
no_common_prime_is_coprime : forall x y : nat, x <> 0 -> (forall p : nat, prime p -> divides p x -> divides p y -> False) -> is_gcd x y 1
Fin.to_nat_of_nat : forall h : ?p < ?n, Fin.to_nat (Fin.of_nat_lt h) = exist (fun i : nat => i < ?n) ?p h where ?p : [p : nat Hp : p <> 0 |- nat] ?n : [p : nat Hp : p <> 0 |- nat]
Zp_mult_assoc : forall x y z : Z_Zp, x ⊗ (y ⊗ z) = x ⊗ y ⊗ z
Zp_opp = fun H : Z_Zp => let (x, _) := H in exist (fun x0 : nat => x0 < p) (rem (p - x) p) (div_rem_spec2 (p - x) Hp) : Z_Zp -> Z_Zp
Zp_mult_comm : forall x y, x ⊗ y = y ⊗ x
Zp_mult_plus_distr_r : forall x y z : Z_Zp, (y ⊕ z) ⊗ x = y ⊗ x ⊕ z ⊗ x
Zp_mult_plus_distr_l : forall x y z : Z_Zp, x ⊗ (y ⊕ z) = x ⊗ y ⊕ x ⊗ z
Zp_plus_zero : forall x, Zp ⊕ x = x
Zp_minus : forall x, x ⊕ ∸ x = Zp
Zp_one = exist (fun x : nat => x < p) (rem 1 p) (div_rem_spec2 1 Hp) : Z_Zp
natr_ring_lemma1 : forall (n : nat) (l : list nat) (lpe : list (Ring_polynom.PExpr N * Ring_polynom.PExpr N)) (pe1 pe2 : Ring_polynom.PExpr N), Ring_polynom.interp_PElist 0 1 Init.Nat.add Init.Nat.mul (SRsub Init.Nat.add) (SRopp (R:=nat)) eq N.to_nat id_phi_N (pow_N 1 Init.Nat.mul) l lpe ->...-> Ring_polynom.PEeval 0 1 Init.Nat.add Init.Nat.mul (SRsub Init.Nat.add) (SRopp (R:=nat)) N.to_nat id_phi_N (pow_N 1 Init.Nat.mul) l pe1 = Ring_polynom.PEeval 0 1 Init.Nat.add Init.Nat.mul (SRsub Init.Nat.add) (SRopp (R:=nat)) N.to_nat id_phi_N (pow_N 1 Init.Nat.mul) l pe2
rem_diag : forall p : nat, p <> 0 -> rem p p = 0
bezout_rel_prime_lt : forall p q : nat, 0 < p < q -> is_gcd p q 1 -> {a : nat & {b : nat | a * p + b * q = 1 + p * q /\ a <= q /\ b <= p}}
is_gcd_mult_lcm : forall p q g l : nat, g <> 0 -> is_gcd p q g -> g * l = p * q -> is_lcm p q l
bezout_rel_prime : forall p q : nat, is_gcd p q 1 -> {a : nat & {b : nat | a * p + b * q = 1 + p * q}}
is_gcd_0 : forall p q : nat, is_gcd p q 0 -> p = 0 /\ q = 0
rem_lt : forall p : nat, p <> 0 -> forall a : nat, a < p -> rem a p = a
is_rel_prime_mult : forall p q l : nat, is_gcd p q 1 -> is_gcd p l 1 -> is_gcd p (q * l) 1
measure_rect : forall (X : Type) (m : X -> nat) (P : X -> Type), (forall x : X, (forall y : X, m y < m x -> P y) -> P x) -> forall x : X, P x
div_full : forall q p : nat, {n : nat & {r : nat | q = n * p + r /\ (p <> 0 -> r < p)}}
mscal_S : forall (X : Type) (m : X -> X -> X) (u : X) (n : nat) (x : X), mscal m u (S n) x = m x (mscal m u n x)
is_rel_prime_expo : forall p q l : nat, is_gcd p q 1 -> is_gcd p (mscal Init.Nat.mul 1 l q) 1
rel_prime_mult : forall a b c : nat, is_gcd a c 1 -> is_gcd b c 1 -> is_gcd (a * b) c 1
Nat.mul_cancel_r : forall n m p : nat, p <> 0 -> n * p = m * p < -> n = m
euclid : forall n d : nat, d <> 0 -> {q : nat & {r : nat | n = q * d + r /\ r < d}}
mult_is_one : forall p q : nat, p * q = 1 -> p = 1 /\ q = 1
prime = fun p : nat => p <> 1 /\ (forall q : nat, divides q p -> q = 1 \/ q = p) : nat -> Prop Arguments prime _%nat_scope
divides_1_inv : forall p : nat, divides p 1 -> p = 1
mk_rt : forall (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rsub : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop), (forall x : R, req (radd rO x) x) -> (forall x y : R, req (radd x y) (radd y x)) -> (forall x y z : R, req (radd x (radd y z)) (radd (radd x y) z)) -> (forall x : R, req (rmul rI x) x) -> (forall x y : R, req (rmul x y) (rmul y x)) -> (forall x y z : R, req (rmul x (rmul y z)) (rmul (rmul x y) z)) -> (forall x y z : R, req (rmul (radd x y) z) (radd (rmul x z) (rmul y z))) ->...-> ring_theory rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp req
mscal_0 : forall (X : Type) (m : X -> X -> X) (u x : X), mscal m u 0 x = u
divides_is_gcd : forall a b c : nat, divides a b -> is_gcd b c 1 -> is_gcd a c 1
bezout_nc : forall p q : nat, is_gcd p q 1 -> exists a b : nat, a * p + b * q = 1 + p * q
Zp_mult = fun H : Z_Zp => let (x, _) := H in fun H0 : Z_Zp => let (y, _) := H0 in exist (fun x0 : nat => x0 < p) (rem (x * y) p) (div_rem_spec2 (x * y) Hp) : Z_Zp -> Z_Zp -> Z_Zp
Zp_plus = fun H : Z_Zp => let (x, _) := H in fun H0 : Z_Zp => let (y, _) := H0 in exist (fun x0 : nat => x0 < p) (rem (x + y) p) (div_rem_spec2 (x + y) Hp) : Z_Zp -> Z_Zp -> Z_Zp
div_rem_spec2 : forall q p : nat, p <> 0 -> rem q p < p
is_gcd_rel_prime : forall p q g : nat, is_gcd p q g -> exists a b : nat, p = a * g /\ q = b * g /\ is_gcd a b 1
bezout_sc : forall p q a b m : nat, a * p + b * q = 1 + m -> divides p m \/ divides q m -> is_gcd p q 1

```intros x H. destruct H as [Hdiv1 [Hdiv2 Hgcd]].
exists (exist _ 1 _).
apply pair_equal_spec.
split.
- rewrite Zp_mult_one. reflexivity.
- rewrite Zp_mult_one. reflexivity.```

original: intros x H. destruct H as [Hdiv1 [Hdiv2 Hgcd]]. exists (exist _ 1 _). apply pair_equal_spec. split. - rewrite Zp_mult_one. reflexivity. - rewrite Zp_mult_one. reflexivity.
